sourceMeaningMnemonic: You give <radical>bamboo</radical> to <radical>someone</radical> and they make them into <kanji>chopsticks</kanji>. They are very talented at turning bamboo into bamboo chopsticks. This someone is an expert at their profession.
meaningInfo: Watch this person take ordinary bamboo and transform it into chopsticks right before your eyes. Hear the whooshing and whittling sounds as they form the bamboo into chopsticks with expert speed and precision.
readingMnemonic: Now use those <kanji>chopsticks</kanji> to eat some delicious <reading>hash</reading> (<ja>はし</ja>) browns! That's what chopsticks were made for. That's what they're always made for.
readingInfo: Imagine trying to pick up hash browns with your chopsticks. They would be really hard to eat if you didn't have these handy eating tools!
